org.bicycleGeometryWorkshop.components

Class BaseComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bicycleGeometryWorkshop.components.BaseComponent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AttributeSetOwner
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Bicycle, Cranks, FrameSet, HandleBar, HandleBarAero, HandleBarDrop, HandleBarRiser, HandleBarStraight, Pedals, Rider, RiderMeasurements, RiderPose, Saddle, SeatPost, Stem, VisualPreferences, Wheel

    public abstract class BaseComponent
extends java.lang.Object
implements AttributeSetOwner
    BaseComponent class is basic building block for all the parts of a Bicycle. All the various parts (frame, wheels, etc.) are built from this class.

    This class is used to provide a common mechanism for storing an attribute set and geometry associated with a visual (physical) component. The component uses the attribute set for the inputs, generates the geometry, and updates the bounding box. The component bounding box is managed internally, and is used for calculating the display bounding box.

    When an attribute within the component's attribute set is changed, the event handler calls update on the component. Update in turn calls updateGeometry() and then updateBounds(); Every component defines updateGeometry(), and can not implement a unique updateBounds(). The geometry collection must be maintained (not left empty if references are broken) for the updateBounds mechanism to function.

    There are also factory methods for creating attributes and geometry.

      • addLengthAttribute

        protected final DoubleAttribute addLengthAttribute(java.lang.String name,
                                                   double value,
                                                   double min,
                                                   double max,
                                                   java.lang.String description)
        Add a Length attribute to the component. This is the most common attributes and is used to describe all linear measurements. The length attribute is always considered to be in millimeters. The value does not change when it is displayed in inches (that is solely a display mechanism).
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the attribute.
        value - The length in millimeters.
        min - The minimum value.
        max - The maximum value.
        description - The description of this attribute.
        Returns:
        The created double attribute.
